text: my advice for the current mba students
especially the women but all of them is
to think about their life and their
career as one question and not as two
questions
sometimes people say oh it's a work-life
balance issue
and they try to make decisions that are
that i want to have it all decision
and in fact it turns out that it's in
stages that life is in stages and it's
more of a marathon than a sprint and so
my advice would be try not to be too
short-sighted about it but have the long
view and say what will be what does my
life need to look like over the next
three years because sometimes you'll
want to lean forward in your career
sometimes you'll want to lean back and
say you know this set of opportunities
isn't that interesting right now i'd
rather do more
outside of work or i'd like to run for
political office or i'd like to
try to run a non-profit board or i'd
like to spend more time with my family
and that if you see your life in stages
that it doesn't all have to be perfect
at one time
you can optimize on different dimensions
at different periods of time so i think
i'd say take the long view
